subject: Sexual Health
title: How Condoms Work
description: A short lesson to help you apply How Condoms Work.

hook.text: A thin barrier of latex or polyurethane can block bacteria, viruses, and sperm with remarkable effectiveness.

buildup.text: Condoms create a physical wall that prevents direct contact between mucous membranes and bodily fluids.

discovery.text: When used correctly every time, condoms reduce HIV transmission risk by about 90% or more.

twist.text: Condoms are less effective against STIs spread by skin contact, like herpes and HPV.

climax.text: Despite limitations, condoms remain the single most accessible and effective STI prevention tool.

quiz.question: How much can correct condom use reduce HIV risk?
